item.title: Install Docker client tools
item.description: You need to install Docker Engine on your workstation Try your system package manager Some Linux distributions have decent packages for up-to-date Docker versions. Some other distributions lag behind by several versions, or may even introduce non-standard changes of their own. Your mileage may vary with different operating systems. If you’re on Arch Linux, this is known to be a good configuration: Run this on your Arch Linux workstations: :: sudo pacman -S docker docker-compose docker-buildx Use the generic Docker installer If your Linux distribution doesn’t provide a Docker package, or you’ve decided its not good for your situation, you may be better off by running the generic installer script from the upstream Docker organization:

item.title: Install d.rymcg.tech tools
item.description: Install d.rymcg.tech and its dependencies on your workstation. Install dependent packages If you run Fedora workstations, run this as root :: dnf install bash gettext openssl git xdg-utils jq sshfs curl \ inotify-tools httpd-tools make wireguard-tools If you run Debian/Ubuntu workstations, run this as root :: apt-get install bash build-essential gettext git openssl \ apache2-utils xdg-utils jq sshfs wireguard curl \ inotify-tools If you run Arch Linux workstations, run this as root :: pacman -S bash base-devel gettext git openssl apache xdg-utils \ jq sshfs wireguard-tools curl inotify-tools Clone d.

item.title: Create SSH config and Docker Context
item.description: To remotely control your Docker host from your workstation, you need two additional configs: SSH Host config in ~/.ssh/config. Docker Context config via docker context create .... Both of these can be created automatically by running: Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: d context new This will prompt you if you really want to proceed: (stdout) ? This command can help create a new SSH config and Docker context.

item.title: Install Docker on your remote host
item.description: The base Debian image only has a few basic commands preinstalled. You must now install the Docker packages and enable the service: Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: d install-docker Tip d install-docker will install Docker on the remote VPS, according to your current docker context. Test that the context works from your workstation Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: docker run hello-world Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: docker ps

item.title: Main config for d.rymcg.tech
item.description: Select your active Docker context Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: d context Each Docker context has a separate config file (.env_{CONTEXT}), stored in the root d.rymcg.tech directory (~/git/vendor/enigmacurry/d.rymcg.tech), so you must actively select your current context before you can configure it. Configure d.rymcg.tech for the current Docker context Run this on your Workstation Bash shell :: d make - config This will create a config file for your current Docker context, and name it .
